alert.note: Alert for Alcorn; Benton; Tippah (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Lafayette, east central DeSoto, Marshall, central Tippah, northeastern Tate, Benton, northwestern Alcorn, southeastern Fayette, southern Hardeman, southern McNairy and west central Hardin Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1215 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Somerville to Hernando. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Corinth, Holly Springs, Bolivar, Ripley, Selmer, Wall Doxey State Park, Big Hill Pond State Park, Lamar, Byhalia, Blue Mountain, Snow Lake Shores, Theo, Bethlehem, Red Banks, Laws Hill, Canaan, Pocahontas, Lagrange, Slayden and Marianna. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northeastern and northwestern Mississippi...and west Tennessee.
